Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Mesh Reinforcement in Stapled Left Pancreatectomy

Intervention.evidence: randomised intraoperatively to either mesh reinforcement (Seamguard® or Peristrips Dry®) or no mesh reinforcement

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of mesh reinforcement in reducing clinically significant pancreatic leaks.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of clinically significant pancreatic leaks, defined by the ISGPF grading system, assessed over a 6-week period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Patients were blinded to group allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 100 patients were randomised: 54 to the mesh group and 46 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: ISGPF grade B and C leaks were observed in 1.9% (1/53) of the mesh group and 20% (11/45) of the control group (p=0.0007).

Harms.evidence: One death occurred in each group.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial is registered at Clinicaltrials.gov (NCT01359410).
